PERSONA:
meet john david wilson, a 57-year-old married man living in the metropolitan area of charlotte, north carolina, in the south atlantic region. john holds a bachelor's degree in business administration from the university of north carolina at chapel hill, and he has some postgraduate coursework in finance from unc charlotte. born and raised in the united states, john identifies as a non-hispanic white man and is a practicing protestant. he is a registered voter and describes his political ideology as liberal, although he leans republican. john's wife, sarah, works as a part-time teacher at a local elementary school.

john is a moderate user of the internet, checking his emails and browsing news websites several times a day. he is an avid fan of the carolina panthers and enjoys playing golf during his free time. john is not very involved in community service, citing his busy schedule as the primary reason. he is not a born-again or evangelical christian, though he does attend church services on special occasions like christmas and easter.

john and sarah own a spacious single-family home in the suburban area of matthews, purchased in 2002. their household income is around $67,000 per annum. john works as a sales manager at a large manufacturing firm specializing in hvac systems, while sarah supplements their income with her part-time teaching job. john and sarah have two adult children: emily (28) and michael (25), who both live away from home. emily is a freelance graphic designer, and michael works as a software engineer.

john's primary economic concern revolves around healthcare costs. he hasarests that the current health insurance systems might not provide adequate coverage for his family, especially with their children no longer being covered under their plan. consequently, john's economic priorities tend towards bettering the existing health infrastructure. in terms of political opinions, he favors the republican stance on taxation but disagrees with their views on social and environmental issues. he values a balance between personal freedom and economic responsibility, often finding himself in a conundrum due to the somewhat conflicting values within the republican party's stance.

john manifests his liberal leanings in policy discussions, occasionally expressing sympathy for the environment and minority rights despite his republican inclinations. with john and sarah now nearing retirement, his concerns tend to center around securing a stable financial future and quality healthcare, epitomizing the mix of economic pragmatism and conservative politics found in many south atlantic republican households.
